means: (20世纪初奥地利小说家)卡夫卡风格的
卡夫卡式的；恐怖而怪诞的

sentence.Network_en: My attempt to get a new passport turned into a Kafkaesque nightmare.
sentence.Network_cn: 我试图申请新护照的过程变成了一场官样文章的噩梦。

sentence.Network_en: The characteristics of kafkaesque s personality mechanism was fear and self - abasement.
sentence.Network_cn: 恐惧和自卑是卡夫卡人格机制的主要特征.

sentence.Network_en: At times the trials of Mikhail K have been almost Kafkaesque.
sentence.Network_cn: 有时,米哈伊尔?K(译者注:也就是霍多尔科夫斯基)的审判也充满了卡夫卡色彩.

PerfectNetExp.abs: The characteristics of kafkaesque s personality mechanism was fear and self - abasement ., 恐惧和自卑是卡夫卡人格机制的主要特征.
kafka 话语方式, kafkaesque 卡夫卡的, kafkae 卡夫卡

means.word_mean: 1. characterized by surreal distortion and a sense of impending danger;

sentences.sentence: "the kafkaesque terror of the endless interrogations"

auth_sentence.content: Their defenselessness has something Kafkaesque about it.

auth_sentence.content: Then James called the whole thing Kafkaesque.
